outputs.output_descr: The project support access to justice for all with particular focus on the most vulnerable groups, including women, children and inmates. It also supports the coordination of the Justice Sector through the JRLOS, the provision of legal aid and the capacity building of national institutions including CSOs to report on international human rights instruments.
outputs.output_title: Support to the Ministry of Jus

outputs.output_descr:
This programme will sustain the progress made in restoring relationships and rebuilding trust among Rwandans following the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi. In particular, the UN will support strengthening of the capacities of NURC and community actors to promote dialogue, undertake further research, mediation, unity and reconciliation processes at both central and local level including the strengthening of reconciliation forums.
To ensure availability of quality data on peace, unity and reconciliation, the UN will support further research initiatives including sustaining the reconciliation barometer.

The project "Support to Rwanda National Police (RNP) will pay special attention to institutional capacity strengthening of the Rwanda National Police force to prevent, investigate and adequately respond to crime, particularly related to Gender
Based Violence (GBV), domestic violence and violence against children. The programme will aso strengthen the capacity of the Community Policing Committees to prevent crimes in their communities.

This output provide substantive inputs to the overall management and oversight of the Access to Justice programme, including monitoring and evaluation, audit, and all quality assurance related activities.

The flagship programme on Advancing and Sustaining Gender Equality Gains in Rwanda (2013-2018) is a
joint programme between the National Gender Machinery and the One UN in Rwanda. It brings together four (4) institutions that make up the National Gender Machinery in
Rwanda namely, the Ministry of Gender and Family Promotion (MIGEPROF), the Gender Monitoring Office
(GMO), the National Women's Council (NWC) and the Rwanda Women Parliamentary Forum (FFRP).

project_descr: Promoting Access to Justice, Human Rights and Peace Consolidation in Rwanda
project_title: Promoting Access to Justice, Human Rights and Peace Cons
